title: General Esthetician
description:
General Esthetician-

  • Complete services as booked by client to the standards and specifications of Bliss YogaSpa
  • Comply to uniform and hygiene Standards of Bliss YogaSpa
  • Maintain facility cleanliness to standards of Bliss YogaSpa
  • Maintain continuity of services and performance
  • Contribute to the positive morale and atmosphere of Bliss YogaSpa
  • Contribute to a safe work environment
  • Assess each client's skin condition, appearance and other characteristics, advise about skin care and treatment of problem areas
  • Suggest appropriate homecare, including how to clean and care for skin properly
  • Provide range of spa treatments including but not limited to manicures, pedicures, shellac polish applications, facials and other skin treatments using specialized products and techniques
  • Advise clients and sell skin care products
  • Maintain and sanitize equipment
  • Maintain accurate and complete client, facility and sanitation records

· Provide thorough consultations, skin care and treatment analysis pertaining to the needs of each individual client

· Increase the well-being of our guest by promoting internal and external healthy lifestyle alternatives

· Providing services including waxing of all areas on the face and body

· Eyelash and brow tint services / eyelash lift services

· Facials will include skin care analysis, application of professional products, steaming of the skin and extractions.

· Perform a neck and shoulder massage/ a hand and arm massage as service compliments

· Provide chemical and enzyme peel treatments along with microdermabrasion

· Flip rooms after each service and follow cleaning and sanitization protocols for all services you will be providing

· Complete duties as assigned by Supervisors, Directors, Managers and Owners

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $20,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • general esthetics : 2 years (required)

title: newFacility Services Manager
description:
Interior HomeCare Solutions has been providing nursing, rehabilitative, therapeutic, hospice, and assistive care services to children, adults, and seniors in the comfort of their homes for over 25 years.

We are looking for a Licensed Practical Nurse who is looking to take on a more administrative function in a managerial capacity. The ideal candidate will be able to provide day to day operations support to our staff at two assisted living and long term care facilities in Vernon and Armstrong respectively.

BENEFITS

- Medical, dental and extended benefits upon successful completion of employment probation and meeting eligibility requirements

- Employee Assistance Program

- Working primarily Monday – Friday 8:30 – 4:30 (there may be times when you are required outside those hours)

- Ability to flex time as needed/appropriate

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Oversee the general program operations, including the development and implementation of policies and procedures, staffing structure, etc.

- Supports staff in working directly with clients, including providing programmatic supervision

- Identifies opportunities to improve employees’ skill base and setting standards for coaching and appraising employee performance

- Develops and ensures unit schedules are posted and implemented taking into consideration suitability, skills and abilities

- Ensure all required documentation is completed in an accurate, thorough, and timely manner

- Maintains current and complete personnel file including updated training

- Addresses complaints and resolves problems in a timely manner

- Oversees coverage for visitors and visitation

- Ensures resident rights are protected and always enforced

- Coordinates with other disciplines to ensure continuity of treatment

- Resolves any conflict between staff, facility management, and residents in a timely manner.

- Co-chairs the OH&S committee on a rotating basis, participates in workplace inspections and investigations.

- Steps in by filling open shifts as required

- Schedules, Posts, and fills jobs as per union requirements, maintains communication with the union regarding postings, vacancies, and discipline matters

REQUIREMENTS

- Registration in good standing with the BCCNM

- Minimum of four years of professional supervisory experience and/or managerial experience in human services

- Proficient in using Microsoft office, scheduling programming, cloud-based computing

- Strong organizational and communication skills

- Ability to work well in a team atmosphere

Questions about the position before you apply? Call the Interior HomeCare Solutions Head Office at 250-542-9717 to speak with a manager.

We want to thank all candidates for their interest. Only successful candidates will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $32.98 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vernon, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

Experience:

  • Management in a Healthcare Setting: 4 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registration with BCCNM (preferred)
  • Proof of Vaccination (preferred)
  • Nursing License (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)
  • Night Shift (preferred)
  • Overnight Shift (preferred)

title: Client Service Coordinator-afterhours and weekends
description:
Make “being the difference” your Career. .
Bayshore is looking for a Client Service Coordinator to join our amazing team. This important customer service role is responsible for answering service inquiries and scheduling field employees to client care assignments.

If your calling is to be the “difference” by providing outstanding customer service, than a Career with Bayshore is the Perfect Fit for YOU!

We value our Bayshore employees with:
  • Rewarding Careers
  • Highest industry wages for the critical work you do
  • Company sponsored Benefits (health and dental) for you and your family
  • Paid orientation and paid training
  • Efficient work schedules
  • Opportunities to grow in your career
  • Easy Access to managers who listen and support the important work you do!


Job Qualification

Education
Minimum - Secondary School Diploma along with completion of a related coursed such as Medical Terminology is preferred.

Experience
A minimum of two years related customer service experience, preferably in healthcare.

Other Skills and Abilities
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills are required. Ability to work effectively independently and as part of a team. Demonstrated competency in keyboarding and
Windows scheduling software. Ability to operate all standard office equipment; proficiency in written and spoken English as well as French in Branch Offices that provide service to French speaking clients.

As Canada’s largest and best homecare company, join us as we continue our 50+ year tradition of supporting our Administrative staff to make “being the difference” a Career!



Bayshore is committed to a high quality and safe environment for both our staff and clients/patients. At Bayshore all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two dose vaccine series or one dose of a single- dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the official start date of hire. Medical exemptions or any other kinds of requested exemptions based upon Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.



All Bayshore locations operate in accordance with all applicable Federal and Provincial Accessibility & Human Rights legislative requirements.

title: Employee Relations Advisor - Permanent - Full Time Position
description:
Join the Northwood Team!

Northwood is currently accepting applications for an Employee Relations Advisor,

Reporting to the Manager, People Services,

Major Responsibilities:

  • Participates in the review, revision, introduction and implementation of Human Resources policies, guidelines and processes
  • Assists with the development, implementation and evaluation of the performance management processes across the organization
  • Provides leadership to and is a resource person for conflict resolution and mediation across the organization

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree, Community College Diploma in Human Resource Management or equivalent education and experience
  • 3-5 years progressive experience in a Labour Relations/Human Resource Generalist role
  • Experience in a highly unionized, long term care and/or homecare setting required
  • Experience with collective bargaining, grievance and arbitration management
  • Experience in Organisational Health and Safety considered an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage a high volume of variable assignments
  • Excellent interpersonal, relationship building, and communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office and HRIS (preferably Avanti)
  • CHRP designation is preferred
  • A valid Nova Scotia Driver's License with reliable transportation to travel between sites and work outside of regular business hours on occasion.

Hours of Work: 80 hours bi-weekly

Effective: Immediately

To learn more about Northwood please visit our website www.northwood.care

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $59,703.00-$74,626.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Halifax, NS: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

title: newBusiness Development Manager (BDM)
description:
Position Profile

The Business Development Manager is an energetic self-starter that will be accountable for business development and sales in targeted Lines of Business (LOB) at Affinity Health (AH). The ideal candidate is a goal-driven individual who is comfortable working with defined sales targets that align with the strategic business plan. This individual will be responsible for, with a primary focus on either (i) staff replacement or (ii) homecare, defining & managing the sales process, end to end. This includes responsibility for new business development (prospecting, proposing, and closing), coordinating ongoing sales, account management, developing and executing marketing initiatives, and assisting in various other business development activities at AH.

Key Activities and Responsibilities

Within the context of the corporate strategic plan, polices & procedures of the company, and standards of patient care as defined in legislation and standards of clinical practice, the BDM shall, as required by AH management, be responsible for:

· Increasing total number of clients and revenue for AH

· Achieve revenue targets

· Maintain gross margin and receivables within accepted parameters

· Maintain and expand where possible, customer relationships and satisfaction. Engagement of AH management in the account where appropriate is expected.

· Acquiring new clients using multiple channels

· Effectively delivering, updating and adapting marketing collateral & presentations for AH

· Documenting, communicating and implementing a comprehensive service-wide sales plan within the assigned LOB which will include input from regional leaders and AH management, clear measurable objectives, supporting initiatives with metrics, risks and risk mitigation actions

· Assisting with competitive analysis on pricing and services on a timely basis

· Achieving all sales goals and metrics consistently

· Cultivating and maintaining positive relationships at all levels of the organization with current clients and prospects. This includes leveraging AH management team among other for executive alignment as well as deepening and expanding AH position in account

· Executing territory sales strategies to maximize territory coverage of both existing and prospective clients

· Actively spreading brand awareness through organizing and participating in lead-generation activity including trade shows, community education, and marketing campaigns as appropriate

· Participating in the development of national and regional business development plans and strategies.

· Supporting regional leaders and Head Office staff in business development activities, brand enhancement, partnership activities, and general community relations

· Making recommendations for changes in marketing, pricing, sales tactics, and other relevant operational issues in an effort to improve business development and sales results.

· Other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skill, & Requirements

Based on the Key Activities, the required qualifications to be successful in this role include:

· A minimum of 5 years of sales and business development experience in the healthcare industry, preferably home and community care

· At least 5 years of experience working in a services environment with demonstrated track record of understanding, preferably in staffing or homecare or other relevant industries, client needs, client environment, stakeholder issues, government & institutional processes related to procuring external services, and public sector issues as it relates to homecare, long term care, and hospital services

· Demonstrated ability to own a sales and business development process and provide support to regional leaders and AH management, as required, to achieve sales targets

· Effective relationship management skills to influence decision-making and outcomes within own and client organizations

· Advisory approach to interacting at senior levels of client organizations; able to bring strong business judgment and all AH resources to bear on solution development and successfully concluding the sale

· Business skills in decision making, planning and strategic thinking which includes ability to envision long-term needs and integrate them with current demands

· Undergraduate degree in sales and/or marketing

· Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and generating quick and tangible results

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $100,000.00-$200,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Flextime
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Fully vaccinated.

Application question(s):

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and generating quick and tangible results

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Sales: 5 years (required)
  • services environment: 5 years (required)

Language:

  • English (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 50% (required)

title: newRegistered Nurse Client Care Manager
company: Home Instead Senior Care - Downtown Toronto
description:
About Us

At Home Instead, we’re celebrating 2 decades of providing highly personalized care to seniors in Central Toronto. Our motto "To us, it's personal®" is more than just words. It's a principle that permeates everything we do.

Why work with us

We invite you to be part of a well-established, highly regarded home care agency in Central Toronto. Our Home Instead office is in the top 1% of offices within the worldwide global network.

A career with Home Instead - Central Toronto office means something. It means your work will have a positive impact on seniors, families, and caregivers. It means your ideas, passion, and professional goals are supported with resources and recognition. It means your talent, experience, and ambition is recognized and rewarded.

At Home Instead - Central Toronto office, we:

  • Put people first.
  • Bring people together and create a sense of team and community.
  • Empower people to own their role.
  • Create a space where people can be themselves, while valuing diversity.

If you are a Registered Nurse looking for a rewarding career in family funded homecare setting , we would love to hear from you. Home Instead is looking to hire a Registered Nurse for the role of a Client Care Manager.

The Client Care Manager is expected to perform a variety of duties including but not limited to:

  • Conduct care consultations and assessments either in-person or virtually.
  • Oversee client, caregiver and/or PSW introductions either in-person or virtually.
  • Continuously evaluate the care plan through a series of ongoing communications and visits to ensure high quality care, client and caregiver satisfaction and retention.
  • Work with other team members to coordinate various aspects of a client’s care.
  • Maintain clear and concise documentation of all clients’ visits, and communication.
  • Liaise between members of the circle of care including, physicians, nurses, social workers, HCCSS staff, Physiotherapists, Occupational Therapists, Speech and Language Pathologists and any other professionals as appropriate with consent.
  • Assist with overall problem solving, conflict resolution with staff or clients.

Qualifications

  • Experience working in a family funded home care setting
  • Various experience in diverse clinical areas with effective critical thinking skills
  • Experience with the geriatric population
  • Ability to work independently, work well within a team.
  • Excellent communication, organizational, problem solving and decision-making skills.
  • Demonstrated awareness of cultural diversity.

Education

  • Bachelor of Science in Nursing

License/Certifications

  • Current registration in good standing with The College of Nurses of Ontario
  • Annual membership with The Registered Nurses Association of Ontario (including Insurance coverage)
  • Current First Aid & CPR certification

Competencies/Skills

  • Excellent general assessment skills
  • Safety assessment skills
  • Infection control
  • Medication management
  • Customer service skills

Experience

  • Experience working in family funded home care setting
  • Geriatric care management experience

*

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday – 9 am to 5 pm
  • Must be available on-call during evenings and weekends as required for client assessment or emergencies.

Location:

Central Toronto

We thank you for your interest, only those applicants selected for interview will be contacted.

Home Instead is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). As such, we strive to make our recruitment processes as accessible as possible and provide accommodations for applicants with disabilities to the best of our abilities. If you require any accommodations during the application and hiring process kindly let us know.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35.00-$45.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

  • Are you available evening / weekends for urgent client assessment and/or emergencies?
  • Have you worked with private home care agency?

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

  • nursing: 5 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 25% (preferred)

title: newOperations Manager
description:
ParaMed Home Health Care is Canada’s leading provider of home care service. We have been providing homecare and wellness solutions since 1974 and operate across Ontario, Alberta, Manitoba and Nova Scotia. With 10,000 employees and over 75,000 clients, we are proud of the impact we bring to our communities through the delivery of high-quality care.

ParaMed is a division of Extendicare, the leading seniors care organization that also owns and operates long term care homes, and retirement homes.


Who is an Operations Manager?

As the Operations Manager, you will provide centralized strategic and tactical leadership to the ParaMed home health business and will work with other members of the leadership team to identify opportunities for operational efficiencies and quality improvement in our delivery of home care services.

You are an operations or healthcare professional that enjoys people leadership and team development. You have a proven record that demonstrates strong problem solving and an aptitude for using data to drive business decisions. You demonstrate a desire to learn the details of operations in community healthcare with a focus on quality and service excellence.


What you will be doing:

  • Lead team of billing and payroll coordinators to process billings and payroll on time
  • Lead Onboarding and Engagement activities of new internal and healthcare staff
  • Lead team of schedulers to effectively and efficiently ensure matching of patients’ needs to caregivers abilities and availability
  • Participate in the interviewing, training, ongoing supervision, and performance management of staff
  • Ensure contract standards are met such as acceptance rates, consistency, missed care and other indicators
  • Ensure operational efficiency and client satisfaction through the analysis of operational data and reports
  • Assure compliance for non-clinical aspects of care plans including assignment of appropriate staff, consistency, and frequency of in-home visits
  • Analyze and approve billing and payroll
  • Participate in the development, and subsequently implement, monitor, and maintain the operations budget
  • Prepare operational forecasting and projection reports
  • Develop the annual training and in service plan for internal operations staff
  • Collaborate and work closely with the Care and Service Manager to ensure Quality of Client Care
  • Participate in Quality Management Programs

Experience you bring:

  • Post-secondary education in Business, Administration, Accounting, Operations Management, Logistics or other relevant field
  • Healthcare experience highly preferable
  • Minimum of two (2) years Supervisory experience accompanied by a minimum of three years of experience in a business/operations role
  • Superior oral and written communication skills to effectively interact with staff, clients, families and other stakeholders
  • Effective skills in critical thinking, business acumen and problem solving
  • Excellent computer skills including experience in Word and Excel are required
  • Able to provide a current, clear criminal background check with Vulnerable Position Screening (VPS)

ParaMed recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our patients and team members from Covid-19. A condition of employment with ParaMed is that all new hires receive all required doses of a Covid 19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.


In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and ParaMed Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of ParaMed hiring process.

title: MANAGER, CLIENT CARE & DEVELOPMENT – HOMECARE COMPANY
description:
We are a small but growing Toronto-based homecare provider with an excellent reputation in the local community. Reporting directly to the co-CEOs Titan MedLife or TML, the Client Care and Development Manager will ensure the delivery of high-quality client services to new and existing clients in accordance with our policies, procedures and standards of confidentiality. This role will have a heavy focus on creating new relationships to grow the company’s client base and monthly billables. A significant bonus is available in addition to the base pay for meeting growth targets with the support of TML’s Integration and Support Team (IST) in the areas of sales, marketing, finance and HR to help the company achieve its annual performance objectives.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Quality control and client satisfaction
  • Staff recruitment, training and performance
  • Client development and reputational enhancement

Compensation:

$50,000 base salary + $30,000 bonus structure

Qualifications:

A RPN or RN designation is required - MUST

  • 2-3 years experience or related experience in Home health care
  • Advanced knowledge of personal support, nursing and rehab therapy service
  • Extensive knowledge of home health care programs and resources.
  • Ability to work physically in the Office and in the Community
  • Ability to provide direct care, while efficiently arrange and perform a wide range of tasks;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, problem solving and written/verbal communication skills;
  • Strong planning; prioritizing, problem solving and project management skills.
  • Good computer skills and technology knowledge of MS office
  • Valid drivers license with vehicle - MUST

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

40 hours per week

Covid 19:

Fully Vaccinated

Full Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) as required

Safe workplace environment

At TML each of us contributes to inclusion—we all have a role to play. Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitment, our curiosity, how we collaborate, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same. In turn, our inclusive culture inspires us to try new things, speak openly, and be bold. It brings us together in ways that help us stand out. Our inclusive culture empowers all of us to connect, belong, and grow.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Fully Vaccinated
Full Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) as required
Safe workplace environment

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • health care: 2 years (required)
  • personal support, nursing and rehab therapy service: 1 year (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • drivers license (required)

Expected start date: 2022-04-18

title: newHealth Care Aide
description:
Make “being the difference” your Career. .



Bayshore is looking for passionate and caring Health Care Aides to join our amazing team in South and West Edmonton. You will be creating special moments for clients each and every day. If your calling is to be the “difference” by providing outstanding care, than a Health Care Career with Bayshore is the Perfect Fit for YOU!

We value our Bayshore caregivers with:

  • Full and Part time Careers including annual salaries
  • Highest industry wages for the critical work you do
  • Company sponsored Benefits (health and dental) for you and your family
  • Retirement Savings Plan
  • Paid orientation and paid training
  • Efficient work schedules with more care time and less travel
  • Opportunities to grow in your career
  • Company provided Mobile devices for easy documentation and strong communication
  • Easy Access to managers and schedulers who listen and support the important work you do!

Job Qualification

Must have a valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle along with Health Care Aide Certificate/ PSW diploma or equivalent. Candidates taking public transit will be considered for respite and building opportunites. Candidates who have completed 1-2 years of Alberta LPN/RN programs will also be considered.

As Canada’s largest and best homecare company, join us as we continue our 50+ year tradition of supporting our PSWs to make “being the difference” a Career!



Bayshore is committed to a high quality and safe environment for both our staff and clients/patients. At Bayshore all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two dose vaccine series or one dose of a single- dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the official start date of hire. Medical exemptions or any other kinds of requested exemptions based upon Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.



Bayshore operates in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and applicable Provincial Human Rights Codes.

title: Strategy Manager
description:
AlayaCare is revolutionizing the way home care is delivered. Our leading cloud-based software allows our clients around the world to manage their employees, scheduling, billing, and enable better delivery of care. We aim to be the operating system for our clients' businesses, helping them and their employees improve clinical outcomes.

We are a fast-growing company with offices in Canada, US and Australia and a team of 650+ employees, and we've been recognized as one of the top growing companies in Canada!

Position Overview:

We're looking for a knowledgeable and driven Strategy Manager to join our fast growing team at AlayaCare. If you're interested in helping us build the future of mobile healthcare, this job is for you.

We are building a workforce management system allowing private homecare agencies around the world to manage their employees (scheduling, client health records, billing, payroll and reporting). We are also building other exciting complementary products (mobile apps for care workers, remote patient monitoring and family portal).

Every single member of the close-knit team located in Toronto, Montreal, and Sydney is committed to building the best product possible to change the homecare industry. To achieve this ambitious goal we work hard, making sure our users providing 750,000 + care visits per month work efficiently.

As a part of the strategy team, you'll help AlayaCare determine the overall direction it should take to succeed, provide recommendations to address key challenges, and identify data-driven ways to grow.

Please note, AlayaCare supports a SuperFlex working model permitting employees to work a blend of in-office and remote work. Remote candidates within Canada and certain US states are welcome to apply.

To provide exceptional service to our customers, candidates should be comfortable working a blend of day and afternoon shifts Monday to Friday with some shared on-call responsibility as required.

You will be working on:

  • Lead Project Management of cross-functional teams to guide implementation of strategic plans and accomplish goals in alignment with departmental key metrics.
  • Support corporate development efforts in financial due diligence for M&A, including the review of financial models, value analyses, presentations, and investment memos for prioritized opportunities.
  • Own the planning and execution of all post-merger integration activities by managing multiple internal stakeholders and maintaining rigorous tracking of all key performance metrics.
  • Maintains roadmap of partnership requirements for newly acquired products, products in transition and all corporate development opportunities.
  • Drive growth of the top of the M&A funnel by searching within all active markets for assets which align with AlayaCare's corporate strategy.
  • Strong collaboration with multiple cross-functional stakeholders, including sales, services, product, marketing and operations.
  • Lead the oversight and measurement of financial and operational benchmarks related to strategic initiatives (i.e. new partnerships, post-merger integration activities).
  • Own identification of potential partnership opportunities, lead partners through the partnership onboarding lifecycle and drive fulfillment of the partner value proposition within AlayaCare.
  • Analyze business cases, understand the business implications of decisions, and provide guidance to stakeholders.

You'll need to have:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • At least 2 years experience in Strategy and/or Corporate Development- related role
  • Experience working in a SaaS environment
  • Experience with health information technology
  • Problem-solving - you find creative ways to address issues
  • Pride in your work and a "get-it-done" attitude - we keep things light at the office and are professional with our clients
  • Ability to build positive, lasting relationships with key stakeholders and teammates
  • Exceptional creative thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills - you are most definitely a people-person
  • Autonomy and capacity to learn by yourself
  • Experience supporting SAAS applications strongly preferred
  • Healthcare experience is considered an asset
  • Bilingual French/English is considered an asset

Why AlayaCare is a great place to work:

  • You make a difference on helping people live longer at home while receiving the best care available
  • RSUs in a growing, well-funded company
  • Supportive and collaborative environment
  • Career growth and development
  • Health and wellness activities
  • Benefits
  • SuperFlex working models
  • Flexible vacation policy

If you are looking to take your career to the next level and join a growing SaaS company offering products that make a difference, we want to hear from you! If this job isn't for you but you know someone who could be the perfect fit, feel free to share this opportunity.

#LI-RB1

title: Physical Therapist
description:
Edmonton Bone and Joint Centre

Casual - Physical Therapist Needed

Monday to Friday Full Time Equivalent (Daytime)

Position Summary

Under the direction of the Allied Health Team Lead and Clinic Director, the Physical Therapist works collaboratively with the multidisciplinary team, to assess, plan, and educate patients, families and caregivers through the continuum of care (pre and post-surgical, and non-surgical).

Key Responsibilities

  • Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates the pre-operative, pre-surgical optimization and post-operative follow-up care for the patient;
  • Participates in team based MSK screening of patients referred for shoulder surgery, knee surgery, hip/knee/shoulder arthroplasty surgeries
  • Functions as liaison with the patient, family, multidisciplinary team, medical community, Alberta Health Services, to manage rehabilitation;
  • Prioritizes and returns phone calls in timely manner;
  • Independently assesses patient at request of surgeon/screening physician, to provide Physical Therapy education and feedback on areas of concern.
  • Completes assessment on all patients, may be completed independently or with the surgeon;
  • Intervention in the form of exercise prescription, equipment and home support recommendations for the non-surgical patient;
  • Completes all required charting and workload measurement tools;
  • Records complete and accurate, relevant data for every patient in accordance with the clinic and professional practice standards;
  • Promotes an environment that supports on going Quality Improvement. Assists in the development of Quality projects/initiatives;
  • Maintains strict confidentiality with regard to patient data and sensitive information;
  • Other duties as requested by management.

Skills

· Superior interpersonal and communication skills required in dealing with a range of situations which may include complex, sensitive and confidential issues;

· Flexible and able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously;

· Strong team player who can work cooperatively and effectively with others;

· Attentive to detail with high level of accuracy;

· Ability to work in a fast paced environment with minimal supervision;

· Excellent written communication skills;

· Excellent organization and time management skills are essential;

· Proficient in Microsoft office applications and clinically based Electronic Medical Record.

Qualifications

Education: Degree in Physical Therapy from an accredited university

Professional Affiliation: Licensed by the Physiotherapy Alberta College and Association.

Basic Cardiac Life Support certification required

Experience: Recent experience working with Orthopedic patients preferred.

Contacts: Internal – Multidisciplinary Team:

· Medical Office Assistant

· Case Managers, Registered Nurses

· Surgeons

· Surgeon Office Staff

· Occupational Therapists

· Administrative Staff

· Management Staff

· Internal Medicine

· Anesthesia

· Laboratory Technician

External:

Patients, patient family/support, healthcare Institutions, regional health authorities, Alberta Health Services, Alberta Bone and Joint Institute, Orthopedic Researchers, Community Physical Therapists and Homecare Agencies.

Note: This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and requirements for the position.

Job Type: Casual

Salary: $35.00-$50.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Physiotherapists: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Physiotherapist (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-06-01

title: Customer Service Rep (2 Year Contract) - Lindsay ON
description:
Customer Service Rep (2 Year Contract) - Lindsay ON

  • 22001030


At Medigas, the healthcare division of Linde Canada, Inc., you’ll join talented and diverse people throughout Canada, all working hard to make a difference in our client’s lives and make our organization successful. You will work to support, develop and implement challenging and meaningful client-focused programs and you will be trusted to take on responsibility early in your career. Our employees’ contributions are valuable to our company, our clients, our communities and our shareholders.


Since the late 1960s, Medigas has been a leader in serving the Canadian healthcare market with the provision of home oxygen therapy, respiratory services, medical gases and related medical equipment. Everything we do is born out of our commitment to help people live better lives and to support the medical professionals who make it all possible.


Customer Service Rep - Store Sales (2 Year Contract) – Lindsay, ON


Medigas is currently recruiting for a Customer Service Representative in Lindsay, ON.


This position is responsible for the Co-ordination of telephone referrals, verification of criteria and appropriates funding in setting up clients for home oxygen therapy and related healthcare services. Receive and process client walk-in or phone orders, inquiries, and/or issues covering items or products ordered along with showroom sales and inquiries from walk-in clients.


The successful candidate will help support the Territory Managers, balancing time between inside sales and customer service duties along with helping the team to achieve a targeted sales budget.


The hours are Monday to Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM.


You will bring with you to this position:

  • High School or equivalent diploma
  • 2 years of customer service experience with proven ability to manage relationships with current and new customers
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Computer skills
  • Commitment to safety is a must
  • Must have a proven ability to manage relationships with current and new customers as well as maintain knowledge of Homecare sales growth and development areas.

Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.

We are committed to employment equity for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Primary Location Ontario-Lindsay
Schedule Full-time
Job Sales & Marketing
Job Posting Mar 18, 2022, 11:00:00 PM
Unposting Date May 20, 2022, 10:59:00 PM

title: newClient Service Assistant
description:
Bayshore is looking for two full-time Client Service Assistants, (Days from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.). Under the direction of the immediate Supervisor, handles client care and service inquiries, arranges client care and service, assist with scheduling Field employees and maintains scheduling information and data as required.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Handle and document prospective client inquiries regarding requests for care and service
  • Assess client service needs in consultation with the Supervisors; schedule licensed and unlicensed employees for care and service assignments such that there is an appropriate match between the client’s needs and the qualifications, skills and abilities of Field employees; promote consistency of caregiver assignments and coordination of services
  • Reports and Collaborates with other Case Managers, funder or government program as required
  • Notify clients and Field employees regarding initial and ongoing schedules
  • Complete data entry and maintain accurate current scheduling documentation
  • Handle and document client concerns and complaints in a timely manner and as appropriate, notify the Supervisors; maintain appropriate documentation
  • Market and promote Bayshore Home Health in keeping with the individual Branch Office Sales and Marketing Plan
  • Participate in ongoing internal and/or external continuing education activities
  • Participate in quality activities and continuous improvement initiatives in keeping with the company's Quality Management System
  • Participates in proactive Health & Safety activities while performing all duties. Is responsible to notify immediate Supervisor of any Health & Safety risks or concerns
  • Maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate Bayshore personnel
  • Complete other tasks as requested

Job Qualification

Education:
Minimum - Secondary School Diploma. Completion of a recognized Program, such as the Licensed/Registered Practical Nurse Program and/or a Medical Terminology course is preferred.

Experience:
A minimum of one year related customer service experience, preferably in healthcare.

Other Skills and Abilities:
Exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills; proven ability to work both independently and as part of a team; ability to meet deadlines and strong commitment to continual learning; demonstrated competency in keyboarding and Windows scheduling software; ability to operate all standard office equipment; proficiency in written and spoken English.


As Canada’s largest and best homecare company, join us as we continue our 50+ year tradition of supporting our Administrative staff to make “being the difference” a Career!

Bayshore is committed to a high quality and safe environment for both our staff and clients/patients. At Bayshore all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the official start date of hire. Medical exemptions or any other kinds of requested exemptions based upon Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

title: Homecare Driver ( Full time ) Sudbury, ON
description:
Homecare Driver ( Full time ) Sudbury, ON

  • 22001368


Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2020 sales of $27 billion (€24 billion). We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain and protect our planet.

The company serves a variety of end markets including chemicals & refining, food & beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing and primary metals. Linde's industrial gases are used in countless applications, from life-saving oxygen for hospitals to high-purity & specialty gases for electronics manufacturing, hydrogen for clean fuels and much more. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions.

For more information about the company and its products and services, please visit www.linde.com.


Primary Purpose

This position is responsible for providing home delivery and pickup of home medical and oxygen equipment products, including respiratory equipment to clients.


Key Accountabilities

  • Deliveries, setups, and pickups of home medical/oxygen equipment within an assigned route in a prompt, courteous, and professional manner
  • Responsible for coordinating vehicle maintenance
  • Safely loading and unloading of home medical and oxygen equipment
  • Work within a high safety standard while identifying and communicating any safety hazards at delivery sites
  • Responsible for completing various regulatory paperwork, including TDG, Vehicle Inspection Reports, Hours of Service etc.
  • Complete routine assessments of equipment and identify potential repairs at customer sites
  • Provide verbal product education and supporting documentation to clients in accordance with company procedures
  • Troubleshoot equipment malfunctions
  • Maintain good housekeeping practices
  • Complete daily inventory tasks
  • Ability to work various shifts, including days, evenings, weekends, and holidays
  • Must be available for afterhours/on-call emergency service on a rotational basis


Required Qualifications

Education

  • High school graduate or equivalent experience

Experience

  • 3 years valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
  • 1-year experience driving with similar type vehicle preferred
  • 1-year experience working in a customer service environment

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities

  • Must be safety oriented
  • Ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects up to 75 pounds
  • Must comply with internal policies, procedures, and Government regulations
  • Strong ability to set priorities and follow through on tasks within tight deadlines
  • Proficiency in Microsoft 365: Must be able to efficiently use Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Excel, and Word
  • Proficiency using smart phone technology
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Must be a team player
  • Must have strong customer focus and patience
  • Must be dependable and accountable (attendance and punctuality)

Nature and Scope

Contacts:

  • Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external customers
    • Supervisors/Managers
    • Customers
    • Healthcare Professionals, Sales, Customer Service, Dispatchers, Warehouse peers

Level of Responsibility:

  • Able to work alone when required and in a team environment.

Decision-Making Authority:

  • Ability to troubleshoot equipment issues and provide solutions to customers
  • Identify and communicating any safety hazards at delivery sites
  • Maintaining, evaluating, and updating daily vehicle routes to accommodate urgent requests to ensure efficient delivery of products to customers

Physical and Sensory Demands:

  • Ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects up to 75 pounds
  • Ability to use hands and arms in handling, installing, positioning, and moving materials, and manipulating parts and tools repetitively
  • Performing physical tasks that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials up to 75 pounds
  • Ability to use abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time to complete specific maintenance tasks.
  • Ability to complete tasks in restricted spaces or awkward positions
  • Ability to spend long periods of time sitting while driving

Working Environment:

  • Company vehicle
  • Customer sites (residential homes, long-term care facilities, retirement homes, hospitals)
  • Warehouse/Office
  • Outdoors in inclement weather (rain, snow, heat, cold, etc.)

Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: After Hours Client Care Coordinator (Homecare)
description:
Position: After hours Client Service Coordinator

Hours weekdays : Monday to Thursday 4:30PM to 8:30AM

Weekend hour: 24 hours starting Fri 4:30PM ongoing until Monday 8:30AM

Position Profile

As our after hours Client Service Coordinator, you will contribute to the success of Affinity Health’s team by delivering exceptional service after regular working hours, on weekends and during holidays. The after hours Client Service Coordinator will act as the contact person for all staff and clients after hours to ensure client and employee safety and continuity. As the after hours Client Service Coordinator, you will also be responsible for delivering a quality and seamless intake process for prospective clients by answering their questions and nurturing the relationship between them and our company, thus building trust in our company and the services we provide. This role brings a deep understanding of social process skills in the area of health services and a passion for supporting not only our current staff and clients but future clients and their families.

Position Role & Responsibilities

  • Receive and process emails and phone calls after hours in a timely manner and in both official languages
  • Ensure effective and courteous communication with all internal and external clients
  • Conduct written and verbal communication in a professional and courteous manner
  • Confirm receipt of new or modified requests via email and phone calls
  • Data entry of all communications with staff, clients, families, and partners in AlayaCare
  • Data entry for new, modified or cancelled shifts in AlayaCare
  • Email summary reports after every after hours shift
  • Maintain liaisons with staff and clients as necessary
  • Ensure regular and proactive communication with all clients to deliver an exceptional customer experience
  • Ongoing management of schedules ie: cancellations, book offs, time changes, sick calls, etc.
  • Assist with issues/concerns/complaints from both internal and externals clients. Escalate appropriately for support to ensure a timely and satisfactory resolution
  • Collaborate with referral partners, internal departments, clinical team members, and other operational colleagues to support shift fulfillment
  • Triage inbound calls to determine next steps utilizing Affinity Health’s tools and resources as it relates to schedules, compliments, complaints, safety concerns, issues, and feedback
  • Follow company protocol to assist an employee in the event of a workplace injury or emergency. This may include but is not limited to: calling 911, arranging transportation for employee if medical assistance is required, completing proper forms and documentation, liaising with the supervisor, arranging for a supervisory visit
  • Complete proper paperwork for a workplace injury such as: incident report, dated notes, and contacting the supervisor to inform them of the events
  • Promptly address all emergency questions and concerns from staff and clients
  • Handle all staff and client scheduling changes in a timely manner and ensure all parties involved are notified promptly
  • Check phone messages regularly and document them accordingly
  • Direct all medical related calls to the After hours nurse
  • Notify the supervisor immediately of any workplace injury, death, or emergency when it relates to any staff or clients
  • Identify and document incoming enquiries from internal and external clients
  • Ensure a timely response to customer enquiries and an effective resolution with regards to their requests
  • Maintain a service level standard for response times to calls and emails
  • Liaise with all departments to assist in the effective transition of enquiries to care providers
  • Conduct outbound calls and emails with internal and external clients to report on enquiry status
  • Data entry to Affinity Health’s various platforms in order to keep data relevant and up to date
  • Ensure safe work practices by adhering to Health and Safety rules and regulations
  • Other assigned duties as requested

*Schedule will vary. Includes two-three (2-3) weekends per month. Weekend includes Friday at 4:30pm to Monday morning at 8:30am and applicable holidays at 8:30am/4:30pm. During the after hours shift, the after hours client service coordinator regularly checks for phone messages except at night, at which time the after hours client service coordinator is expected to listen for the cell phone and responds to those messages that are urgent. All other messages can be answered the next business day. Phone messages that are “out of the ordinary” must be saved until a Client Care Manager reviews them.

** It is expected that the main telephone line at Affinity Health is checked regularly in the evening, until 11pm, and starts at 6am. All urgent telephone messages left on the main line should be responded to immediately. All non-urgent messages should be recorded in the call log and relayed to the appropriate person to be handled on the next business day. During late overnight hours, it is expected that the emergency cell phone is responded to immediately. It is expected that all of the after hours information books, laptop and cell phone, are kept on hand at all times. Regular after-hours and weekend activity may be conducted, provided that the ability to promptly respond to emergency calls is not hindered.

Knowledge and Skill

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate professionally and politely, both orally and verbally, in English and French
  • Ability to multi-task in an ever changing and demanding environment
  • Ability to work under pressure within a fast paced and sometimes stressful environment
  • Eager and motivated to meet performance targets
  • Self-motivating with the ability to work and contribute in a team environment
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Direct experience in the use of various information technologies in support of client care enquiries
  • Detail oriented

Position Requirements

  • Minimum of one (1) year of relevant experience
  • College diploma or University degree in a health-related discipline is considered an asset
  • Ability to effectively communicate in both English and French is required (orally and written)
  • Experience working with seniors
  • Experience working in health care
  • Sales experience is considered an asset
  • Demonstrated proficiency with Share Point and Microsoft software
  • Valid Criminal Record Check with the Vulnerable sector (within 6 months)

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 25 per week

Salary: From $700.00 per week

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

title: RN Case Manager
description:
Position: RN Case Manager

Location: Ottawa, Ontario

Does it appeal to you to join a 5-Star Google Reviews-rated team to make a difference in the lives of people who are dependent on others for personal care and quality of life?

Do you enjoy the challenge of giving your best to your coworkers so that together we give our best to our clients in a respectful and supportive working environment?

If so, please consider joining Team Choice as our RN Case Manager.

Team Choice was founded in 2011 as a private-pay homecare provider and has grown into a leading community and homecare company with over 60,000 care hours annually. We are known for our excellence and long-term loyalty with clients and caregivers, serving private-pay, retirement home, MVA Attendant Care, Veteran's Affairs, and Blue Cross clients. Our differentiation is complex care with specialties in Alzheimer's-Dementia and Acquired Brain Injury.

We started in 2022 Q1 to provide rapid response facility PSW staffing for Health Ontario East through The Ottawa Hospital and we are starting the onboarding process with Ontario Health Home and Community Care. We seek an RN Case Manager to oversee this new business segment. The RN Case Manager is accountable to the Director of Client Care for planning, directing, and operating the public-pay care delivery, including evaluating client and staff, implementing the standards of care, and the development of personnel. Functional accountabilities include client intake, assessments, scheduling, education, reassessments, and ongoing monitoring. Initial accountability will include the current homecare services while the public-pay care volumes ramp up.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Develops and maintains an effective Service Delivery Plan with respect to Community Health Services, independently or in cooperation with the Ontario Health East, LHIN/HCC, and/or TOH as applicable
  • Approves, trains, and monitors Special Functions as outlined in the Regulated Health Professions Act and in compliance with Community Health Services policies and practices
  • Supervises and supports scheduling coordinators
  • Supervises and evaluates community support workers' performance, especially with regard to Special Functions and compliance with Quality Management policies, procedures, and practices
  • Hands-on intake and scheduling during the ramp-up period
  • Maintains current and accurate patient records
  • Maintains positive professional relations
  • Identifies and participates in performance improvement activities
  • Performs other duties as required
Education and Experience Requirements:
  • At least two years of experience working with Ontario Health's LHIN/Home and Community Care
  • Proficiency in interacting with the LHIN/HCC's Service Provider Gateway (SPG)
  • RN diploma or bachelor's degree with a current Certificate of Registration with The College of Nurses of Ontario
  • Thorough knowledge of case management skills, nursing assessment, and nursing processes and practices
  • Proven ability to build quality and implement improvements with policies and procedures and operation
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and analytic/critical thinker
  • Excellent customer service skills and ability to deal tactfully with clients, staff, and community
  • Understands provincial and federal regulatory compliance
  • Ability to travel in Ottawa and surrounding area
  • Ability to be on call on a rotation basis

title: Senior Python Developer (Scheduling)
description:
Senior Developer
We're looking for a passionate senior developer to join our engineering organization, and take part in building the future of homecare software. Delivering over 500,000 episodes of care per month across three continents, the systems you supervise will literally be in caregivers' hands as they're visiting clients in the places they call home.
With engineering hubs in Toronto, Montreal, and Victoria, our 600+ person company (of whom 150+ work in product development) is building a workforce management solution to allow homecare agencies around the world to manage their employees, scheduling, billing, and enable better delivery of care. We aim to be the operating system for our clients' businesses, helping them and their staff improve clinical outcomes.
About the role:
As a senior developer, you will be one of the senior technologists on a product delivery team. Working with your colleagues from the product team and your engineering manager, you'll be responsible for scoping your team's technical work, using your knowledge to ensure it's sequenced properly, and designing & implementing it.
In partnership with other senior members of the engineering group, you will be responsible for setting the product-wide technical roadmap, matching our aspirations with our technical capabilities. You will use your experience and perspective to build security and performance into all you do, and will be on the vanguard of our move to continuous software delivery.
AlayaCare Engineering has parallel career tracks for individual contributors and managers. A senior developer with this level of expertise is on the individual contributor track, at the same level as Engineering Manager. AlayaCare Cloud is written in Python and PHP on the back-end, uses Vue.js on the front-end, and runs on AWS.
In this role you will:

  • Design, code, test, and debug complex software with a high level of quality, sitting as a full-time member of a feature development team
  • Provide technical leadership for your team, and assist in improving your colleagues' skills through technical mentoring, role-modelling, coaching, and knowledge-sharing
  • Monitor your code in production, and proactively identify and fix issues clients are encountering
  • Participate in setting the product-wide technical roadmap, ensuring the success of technical cross-team initiatives and responsible adoption of new technologies and industry trends

About you:

  • 5+ years professional software engineering experience using Python for web development
  • Experience with complex SQL querying and experience working with large and complex datasets
  • Some experience using a JavaScript framework for frontend development
  • Degree or diploma in computer science or engineering, or demonstrated learning experience
  • Awareness of contemporary industry trends in technology, performance, and software development tooling & practice
  • Experience making difficult technical decisions in ambiguous situations
  • Pride in your work

If you have experience writing software for the healthcare or financial services sectors, you should be sure to mention that.
AlayaCare values T-shaped skill profiles, where developers have a breadth of general knowledge and capability across our platforms, combined with a deep knowledge of one or two areas that contribute to effective and performant software delivery. We look forward to hearing about the unique combination of skills that you would bring to this role and to our team.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Consultant, UX Designer HealthConnect
description:
Job Type: Permanent
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto; Montreal


Our Purpose

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.


 

Deloitte is looking for a Product Designer to join its Portfolio of Assets – Health Connect team! Come join our fast-growing team and work with a wide range of products in the Health Care industry.
Our vision is to grow our product and implement technology that simplifies user experience in a complicated health care environment by emphasizing user research and building customer centric features in our product. Our Team mission is to be thought leaders in the health care community, who design meaningful and delightful solutions and bring a human-centered approach to our craft.

What will your typical day look like?

We're searching for a teammate with a proven passion for product design. You’ll collaborate with product managers, engineers and your design teammates to create effective experiences for our clients and their users.
We’re looking for an individual who is passionate about end-to-end, human-centered Product Design with a focus on UX. User research, information architecture, user flows, user experience design, interface design, prototyping and user testing are all central to this role.
Join our growing Product Design team and help shape the future of our Health Connect experience.

About the team

We believe that in order to impact the organizations and communities that we serve, we need to champion an inclusive and equitable culture. We listen, learn, and act on behalf of our team to ensure that everyone has a chance to bring their ideas and contributions to our work, programs, and events. Having a diverse work environment where everyone can be their authentic self is at the heart of Deloitte.
As a Health Connect Product Designer, you will be aligned with our product. You will work with the Health Connect solution, which has sub-offerings for Cancer Screening, Telehealth, Homecare and COVID-19 Recovery, and is designed to enable rapid deployment and scaling for our customers. You will support the visioning and design of Digital Health products built on the Health Connect platform in collaboration with clients.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

Our ideal candidate will have:
  • 2+ years of work experience in Interaction Design / Product Design / User Experience Design
  • A degree in Interaction Design / Product Design / User Experience Design or related fields
  • A strong online portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g.: study plans, reports, visual artifacts).
  • Demonstrated understanding of the end-to-end experience with UX design (research and analysis, concept creation, story and journey mapping, wireframing and UI design).
  • Experience working on complex interaction and workflow design challenges
  • Experience collaborating with product teams (engineers, product managers, QA testers).
  • Demonstrated understanding of building web and native mobile experiences
  • Proficiency with using industry leading design and prototyping tools such as Figma and Sketch
  • Bonus: Prior experience designing products for the Healthcare industry

Our shared values

While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.

They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.

Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

  • Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
  • Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
  • Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
  • Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
  • Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.


The next step is yours


Sound like The One Firm. For You?


At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.

We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Inside Sales Rep (Full Time) - Markham, ON
description:
Inside Sales Rep (Full Time) - Markham, ON

  • 22001017


At Medigas, the healthcare division of Linde Canada Inc., you’ll join talented and diverse people throughout Canada, all working hard to make a difference in our client’s lives and make our organization successful. You will work to support, develop and implement challenging and meaningful client-focused programs and you will be trusted to take on responsibility early in your career. Our employees’ contributions are valuable to our company, our clients, our communities and our shareholders.


Since the late 1960s, Medigas has been a leader in serving the Canadian healthcare market with the provision of home oxygen therapy, respiratory services, medical gases and related medical equipment. Everything we do is born out of our commitment to help people live better lives and to support the medical professionals who make it all possible.


Inside Sales Rep (Full Time) – Markham, ON


The successful candidate will work with the team to achieve a targeted sales budget by focusing on aftermarket selling of used equipment that was given on a trial basis.


Major Responsibilities:

  • Contacting customers to facilitate the sale of equipment in home or arranging pick up of equipment no longer required. Invoicing, Collection of payments, Sales Tracking and completing a Daily Cash Reconciliation.
  • Meet store sales targets, working with Provincial District Managers and Customer Service Teams.
  • Perform customer service activities including answering calls and entering telephone orders, tracing order status and resolving problems.
  • Accountable for providing complete and accurate account set-up and pricing data and ensures ongoing accuracy of customer information.

You will bring with you to this position:

  • High School or equivalent diploma
  • 2 years of customer service/ sales experience with proven ability to manage relationships with current and new customers
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Computer skills, Proficient in Microsoft Excel
  • Commitment to safety is a must
  • Must have a proven ability to manage relationships with current and new customers as well as maintain knowledge of Homecare sales growth and development areas.

Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.


We are committed to employment equity for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Primary Location Ontario-Markham
Schedule Full-time
Job Sales & Marketing

title: Healthcare Account Manager (RRT/RN - Full Time) - Belleville...
description:
Healthcare Account Manager (RRT/RN - Full Time) - Belleville/Kingston, ON

  • Competitive salary
  • Paid vacation
  • Generous Pension Plan
  • Flexible group insurance with flex $$$$
  • Education assistance program
  • Employee assistance program (including assistance for family members)
  • Online learning and development portal

Role Responsibilities :

  • Establish and maintain high quality relationships with referral sources and clients
  • Conduct respiratory equipment in-service training with various community partners
  • Collaborate with internal/external partners to achieve growth targets
  • Perform all duties in accordance with safety standards
  • Assist in the training and development of new employees as required
  • Support the Healthcare Professional and Sleep Support Advisor roles within the organization as required
  • Participate in a regular on-call rotation
  • Ensure client/patient confidentiality

What you bring to the table:

  • Ability to demonstrate empathy towards others
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Able to prioritize and multitask
  • Strong sense of Teamwork and able to interact with other teams
  • Autonomous, resourceful, and organized

Requirements :

  • Valid Respiratory Therapist designation under the CRTO or valid Nursing designation under the CNO (RN or RPN)
  • Prior sales and marketing experience preferred
  • 5 years of applicable experience preferred
  • Experience in the Homecare industry preferred
  • Clear Driving record/abstract
  • Fully vaccinated against Covid 19

Linde has an extensive background check process which may include but is not limited to, a criminal background review, pre-employment medical, driver’s license and abstract review, and may also include reference checks, employment and education verification.

Linde Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Applicants requiring accommodation during the recruitment and selection process are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required. We will work with you to meet your needs.

We are committed to employment equity for women, aboriginal people, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities. Interested candidates from these groups are encouraged to apply.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Primary Location Ontario-Belleville
Schedule Full-time
Job Sales & Marketing
Unposting Date Ongoing

title: newCase Manager (RPN)
description:
For more than 25 years, Affinity Health has provided customized home care services to seniors and their families. We are currently looking for a qualified, dedicated Nurse Case Manager (RPN) for intake and assessments of new clients and managing an on-going caseload. The candidate would ideally have home care experience, exceptional assessment and clinical skills as well a compassionate nature. The position requires the candidate to have flexible availability for assessments and an outgoing personality is an asset!

The job will entail:

  • Completing comprehensive in-home assessments with seniors and their families
  • On-boarding new clients and managing existing client base
  • Working with the marketing team to create communication/material as necessary
  • Coordination of homecare services
  • Creating Client Care plans
  • Completing comprehensive in-home assessments with seniors and their families
  • Coordination of homecare services
  • Communication with other health care professionals and family members

We offer

* Competitive wages
* Benefits packages
* A supportive, caring work environment
* The opportunity to work one-on-one with seniors and truly make a difference in their lives

We are looking for the following qualifications:

* The desire to truly make a difference in a person's life

* Proper certification as a RPN in Ontario

* Experience working with seniors in home care or institutional setting

* Fluent in English; Ability to speak French is a big asset

* Driver's License and vehicle is required

* In person intakes and assessments are required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • LPN/RPN (preferred)
  • Nursing (preferred)
  • CPR Certification (preferred)
